name: Philadelphia Museum of Art
description: One of the largest and most renowned art museums in the country.

name: Barnes Foundation
description: Home to a vast collection of Impressionist, Post-Impressionist, and early Modern paintings.

name: Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts
description: The first and oldest art museum and art school in the United States.

name: The Institute of Contemporary Art
description: A contemporary art museum featuring exhibitions by local and international artists.

name: Rodin Museum
description: Houses one of the largest collections of works by Auguste Rodin outside Paris.

name: The Fabric Workshop and Museum
description: A contemporary art museum with a focus on innovative fabric and textile art.

name: Woodmere Art Museum
description: Focuses on the art and artists of Philadelphia, located in a 19th-century mansion.

name: The African American Museum in Philadelphia
description: Dedicated to preserving, interpreting, and exhibiting the heritage of African Americans.

name: MÃ¼tter Museum
description: A medical museum featuring anatomical specimens, models, and medical instruments.

name: National Liberty Museum
description: Focuses on freedom, diversity, and the heritage of liberty in the United States.

name: The Rosenbach Museum & Library
description: A museum and library housing a world-renowned collection of rare books, manuscripts, and fine art.

name: Penn Museum (University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology)
description: A museum dedicated to archaeology and anthropology, with collections from around the world.

name: The Franklin Institute
description: A science museum and the center of science education and research in Philadelphia.

name: National Museum of American Jewish History
address: 101 S Independence Mall E, Philadelphia, PA 19106
description: A museum dedicated to chronicling the American Jewish experience.
